Package es.courserajava.edu.duke

Class Pixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.courserajava.edu.duke.Pixel
  • public class Pixel
extends Object
    The Pixel class represents a color as its component values of red, green, blue, as well as alpha (for transparency).

    Each of the component values of a pixel must have a value between 0 and 255. If a value is given outside that range, it is changed to be within that range. As such, a negative value would be set to 0 and a value greater than 255 would be set to 255.

    Example usage: 

     ImageResource image = new ImageResource();
 for (Pixel p : image.pixels()) {
     int red = p.getRed();
     int green = p.getGreen();
     int blue = p.getBlue();
     int average = (red + green + blue) / 3;
     p.setRed(average);
     p.setGreen(average);
     p.setBlue(average);
 }
 image.draw();

    This is open-source software released under the terms of the GPL (http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html).

      Creates a new Pixel from with the same values as the other pixel passed as a parameter.
